triageFlags.title: Applicant's Age
triageFlags.description: The applicant's age is below the typical threshold for independent financial responsibility.
triageFlags.recommendation: Consider requesting a guarantor or additional proof of financial stability.
triageFlags.reasoning: Young applicants may lack the financial experience to manage significant credit obligations, increasing the risk of default.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio at Maximum Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio is at the maximum allowable limit for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Verify the accuracy of income and expense data to ensure affordability.
triageFlags.reasoning: A DTI at the maximum threshold leaves no buffer for unexpected financial changes, increasing the risk of financial strain.

content.reasoning: The applicant's credit score qualifies them for Tier A, allowing a DTI of up to 45%. However, their DTI is at the threshold, and their young age (19 years) may indicate limited financial experience. These factors suggest a need for careful consideration and additional verification.
